accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: A group of Rockefeller University scientists made a trip to China, May 5 to May 22, 1977 to learn the situation as it exists in 1977 at a group of universities and research institutions in that country. The trip was made by a 20 person delegation. Arrangements for the trip involved two years of planning, arranged at the request of Dr. Seitz.

The officers and faculty members of the University on the delegation were: Purnell W. Choppin, M.D., Zanvill A. Cohn, M.D., James G. Hirsch, M.D., Maclyn McCarty, M.D., William Trager, Ph.D., Bruce Merrifield, Ph.D., Rodney W. Nichols, Floyd Ratliff, Ph.D., Frederick Seitz, Ph.D., Norton Zinder, Ph.D.

did.unittitle: Report on a visit to the People's Republic of China

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The report is divided into three parts. Part II is made up of technical reports and analyses prepared by: Robert B. Oxnam, Maclyn McCarty, Purnell Choppin, Zanvil Cohn, James Hirsch, Bruce Merrifeld, William Trager, Floyd Ratliff, Norton Zinder.
In Part III are biographical sketches of the faculty and officers on the trip.
